sentence: Wall Street was weaker on Thursday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average extending losses into the close to snap a nine-day winning streak as expectations grew for a December interest-rate increase.
Consumer stocks were among the steepest decliners among the sectors on the S&P 500, which ended at the lowest level in almost a week.
Declines in tech stocks sent the Nasdaq Composite down the most among the measures in its second consecutive loss.
The Federal Open Market Committee opted to hold the target range on the Fed funds rate on Wednesday, while reiterating earlier projections that a third rate hike is likely this year.
That sent the probability of a 25-basis point increase to 75% on the CME Group's FedWatch tool, up from 52% a week earlier.
The FOMC also said it will start the process of normalizing its $4.5 trillion balance sheet next month.
Financials rose 0.2% on the S&P 500, while consumer staples shed 1% and discretionary was down 0.2%.

Procter & Gamble ( PG ) fell 1.9% in the steepest decline on the Dow, while Apple ( AAPL ) shed 1.7%, extending losses after reports Wednesday of connectivity problems in the new series of the Apple Watch.

Economic data on Thursday showed weekly jobless claims fell to 259,000 compared with expectations for 303,000, and the Philadelphia Fed's manufacturing index rose more than forecast to a three-month high of 23.8 in September from 18.9 in August and estimates for 18.
August leading indicators rose 0.4%, better than forecasts for a 0.2% gain and 0.3% in the previous month.
Friday's calendar has the Markit preliminary September Purchasing Managers' Index on services and manufacturing at 9:45 a.m.
ET, while Fed speakers including San Francisco President John Williams and Kansas City chief Esther George offer comments.

Here's where the markets stood by the close:

(+) CCC (+62.12%) Agrees to be bought by Kuraray for $1.1 bln

(+) AKTX (+56.35%) After FDA meeting, will advance lead investigational drug Coversin towards phase 3 clinical studies

(+) MATX (+8.8%) Lease to be amended at Hawaii container terminal

(+) ITUS (+6.22%) Gets U.S. patent for cancer detection technology

(-) ICPT (-24.89%) FDA warns of risk of liver injury due to high dosing of Ocaliva
